question: In the following scheme of reaction, X, Y and Z respectively are:
images/d0f8a9b1-c2e3-1f8a-5b6c-789012345678.png
choices: HF, aqueous KOH and Na in dry ether
Hg₂F₂, alcoholic KOH and Na in dry ether
explanation: X → C₂H₅F (Ethyl fluoride): This is the Swarts reaction, using metallic fluorides like AgF, Hg₂F₂, CoF₂. Hg₂F₂ is a valid reagent.
Y → CH₂=CH₂ (Ethene): This is dehydrohalogenation (elimination), requiring Alcoholic KOH.
Z → C₄H₁₀ (Butane): This is the Wurtz reaction (doubling carbon chain), using Na in dry ether.
Option C matches all reagents: Hg₂F₂, Alc. KOH, Na/ether.
